availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Lorenzo Dow Holloway (Scott County, Kentucky, merchant and soldier - Cpt. 5th Ky. Cav. (C.S.A.))

body.p: Scott County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Son of John Holloway and Margaret Holloway. Married to Elizabeth Poindexter Holloway in Scott County, Kentucky, on October 13, 1842. Father of Edward Holloway, Kate Holloway, Mary Holloway, Caroline Holloway, and Fanny Holloway. Merchant in Scott County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned five enslaved persons in 1850. Postmaster in Scott County in 1854. Merchant in Scott County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Scott County in 1860. Served in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a first sergeant and captain from September 2, 1862 to April 30, 1865.
